phrases.text: Bà con các xóm các làng
phrases.english: Neighbors from various hamlets and villages

facts: Bà con is respectful term for community members
Xóm and làng refer to village subdivisions

phrases.text: Có nghe các ả luôn mồm chê bai
phrases.english: Have you heard those women constantly gossiping and criticizing?

facts: Ả can be somewhat pejorative for women
Chê bai means fault-finding, gossiping

phrases.text: Nào chê tốn vải lưng dài
phrases.english: They criticize for wasting fabric on long skirts

facts: Long skirts required more fabric, seen as wasteful
Clothing was major household expense

phrases.text: Chê ăn no bụng lại quay ra nằm
phrases.english: Criticize for eating full then lying down to sleep

facts: Hard work was valued, rest seen as laziness
Common criticism of young women

phrases.text: Chê bèo cũng chẳng biết băm
phrases.english: Criticize for not knowing how to chop water spinach

facts: Bèo (duckweed/water spinach) is common Vietnamese vegetable
Cooking skills were essential for women

phrases.text: Con gà không biết con tằm chẳng biết nuôi
phrases.english: Don't know chickens, don't know how to raise silkworms

facts: Chicken raising was common household activity
Silkworm cultivation (sericulture) was important income source

phrases.text: Chê thôi chê ủng chê ôi
phrases.english: Criticize, oh criticize and criticize some more!

facts: Repetition emphasizes the relentless nature of gossip
Ủng and ôi add emotional weight

phrases.text: Vậy mà khi trổ mặt lại ngược xuôi liếc hoài
phrases.english: Yet when showing their faces, they keep glancing back and forth

culturalContext.description: Turning point: the critics' hypocrisy revealed
facts: Trổ mặt means to show oneself boldly
Liếc hoài suggests flirtatious glancing

phrases.text: Trầu nguồn chưa nhắm đã cay
phrases.english: Haven't even closed eyes on betel yet, already spicy

culturalContext.description: Metaphor using betel chewing about premature attraction
facts: Betel chewing was traditional social custom
Metaphor suggests inexperienced but eager behavior

phrases.text: Mấy cô gái đẹp về tay học trò
phrases.english: The beautiful girls all belong to the scholars

culturalContext.description: Punchline: scholars win the beautiful girls
facts: Học trò (scholars) were prestigious in Vietnamese society
Education was path to social advancement

phrases.english: Hurray for the number one scholar!

facts: Nhất trò means top scholar
Hô là is exclamation of celebration

patterns.dominantTheme: Satirical song about gossips and the success of scholars
